meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Hemerocallis, with showy flowers that typically last for only one day.
meanings.sent1: The daylily in the garden bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent2: I planted a new daylily in my backyard.
meanings.sent3: The daylily winked at the sun as it opened up.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a daylily in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the daylily captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The flower of a daylily plant.
meanings.sent1: She picked a daylily to put in a vase.
meanings.sent2: The daylily's petals were a deep orange.
meanings.sent3: The daylily whispered secrets to the other flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the fragrance of a daylily.
meanings.sent5: The delicate beauty of the daylily enchanted all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A day on which a daylily blooms.
meanings.sent1: Today is the daylily's special day.
meanings.sent2: The calendar marked the anticipated daylily.
meanings.sent3: The daylily day brought smiles to all the gardeners.
meanings.sent4: The daylily day was like a burst of sunshine in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The children celebrated the daylily day with joy and laughter.
